page.title: 02NAT. MUSEUM OF PHOTOGRAPHY
page.content: The{National Museum} of{Photography, {Film}and{Television} is situated in a spacious building in the city centre. Opened in 1983 by Lord Snowdon, the Museum looks at the past, the present and the future of these visual media. The first 11 display areas to open show, through working models, cameras, laboratory and studio equipment, dramatic reconstructions and pictures, the part played by photography in all our lives. The Museum houses Britain's only{IMAX {Theatre }which has the {country's {largest cinema screen (15.94m high and {19.4m wide) and 6-channel sound. From the Prince's Way Wine & Coffee Bar high up on the second floor, you can sit and watch the moving picture of Bradford City Centre through the panoramic windows while you enjoy a drink, a snack or a full meal.
